data.title: Where was Dear John filmed?
data.meta_description: Want to recreate your favorite Dear John movie scenes? Discover all the filming locations of this popular romantic film and learn how to visit them in real life.

About Dear John

Dear John is a love story that was directed by Lasse HallstrÃ¶m and is based on the novel of the same title written by Nicholas Sparks in 2006. The movie is about John Tyree (Channing Tatum), a soldier, who falls in love with a woman named Savannah Curtis (Amanda Seyfried). After John is deployed to serve in the war, they decide to write letters to each other until their reunion. However, when John returns home, things have changed and the two are forced to confront the realities of their relationship amidst turbulent times. At its heart, Dear John is a beautiful love story about two people who find companionship despite insurmountable odds. The chemistry between Tatum and Seyfried is both palpable and mesmerizing as they embark on an emotional journey that leads them to discover both joys and sorrows in life. The message about true love transcending all boundaries is one that many viewers can relate to. Released in 2010, Dear John received mostly mixed to negative reviews from critics but remains highly regarded amongst Romcom fans for its powerful messages about true love and resilience in hard times. The timeless classic also reminds us all of how special it is to find someone who loves us no matter what life throws our way.

Dear John Locations

Dear John was primarily filmed in the state of South Carolina, USA. From the white sandy beaches on Edisto Island and Sullivan's Island to the breathtaking views of Oak Island, this movie offers a tour through some of South Carolina's most beautiful spots. The majority of scenes were shot in these three locations, each offering its own unique backdrop. On Edisto Island, visitors will find miles of inviting beach and an unmistakable Southern charm, while Sullivan's Island offers up beautiful plantation architecture as well as gorgeous seascapes and vistas. Meanwhile, Oak Island provides a picturesque view of marshland wetlands and riverside forests. A trip to any of the Dear John filming locations is an endeavor worth pursuing. Not only do they offer stunning views of the surroundings, but they also provide an immersive cinematic experience with plenty to explore. From outdoor activities to historical sites, any traveler can appreciate the beauty that South Carolina has to offer.

During the spring break of 2001, John Tyree (Channing Tatum), a Special Forces sergeant taking a break in Charleston, South Carolina, crosses paths with Savannah Curtis (Amanda Seyfried). She is a college student participating in a Habitat for Humanity project that involves building homes with fellow students. After a chance encounter, where John retrieves Savannah's bag from the sea after it falls off the Fishing Pier, they begin to communicate and get acquainted. Front Beach on the Isle of Palms (IOP) in South Carolina is a popular destination for tourists and locals. This stunning beach boasts soft sand, crystal-clear waters, and breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. Visitors to Front Beach can enjoy a wide range of activities, including swimming, sunbathing, beachcombing, and surfing. The beach also offers opportunities for fishing, kayaking, and paddleboarding. Those who prefer to stay onshore can take a stroll along the boardwalk, which offers views of the ocean and the surrounding area. In addition to its natural beauty, Front Beach is home to collections of restaurants, shops, and other attractions. To get to 1300 Ocean Blvd, Isle of Palms, head east on I-26 E towards Charleston which should get you to the Dear John location.

Savannah, feeling appreciative towards John, extends an invitation to him for a barbecue held in front of her beachside home. While at the event, John has the opportunity to meet Tim (Henry Thomas), Savannah's neighbor, and Tim's son, Alan (Braeden Reed), who is autistic. Middle Street is the main thoroughfare on Sullivan's Island, a charming barrier island located just outside of Charleston, South Carolina. As the island's main street, Middle Street houses various shops, restaurants, and other attractions. One of the most popular destinations on Middle Street is Poe's Tavern, a local favorite that pays homage to the island's most famous resident, author Edgar Allan Poe. The restaurant features a menu of delicious pub fare, as well as a variety of craft beers and cocktails. To get to 1109 Middle St, Sullivan's Island, navigate your way there via I-26 E towards Charleston.

After multiple dates over two weeks, John and Savannah gradually develop strong romantic feelings for each other. During one of their outings, they dine at a restaurant on a pier, where Savannah has the chance to meet John's father (Richard Jenkins), who is deeply engrossed with his expanding collection of coins. Bowens Island Restaurant is a seafood destination in Charleston, South Carolina that has amassed a loyal following over the years. Established in 1946, the restaurant is located on a small island close to Folly Road and has become famous for its delectable fried seafood offerings. What sets Bowens Island Restaurant apart from other seafood joints in Charleston is its distinctive, unpretentious atmosphere. The eatery is housed in an unassuming building without any embellishments, but with a generously-sized screened porch that provides diners with a breathtaking view of the water. Despite being immensely popular, the owners have made sure that the establishment retains its casual, easy-going vibe, which appeals to both locals and tourists. With its relaxed ambiance, Bowens Island Restaurant welcomes you to dress comfortably and feel right at home. Get to Bowens Island Restaurant at 1870 Bowens Island Rd, Charleston via US-17 S from downtown Charleston.

Discover Charleston Filming Locations

During a conversation with John, Savannah suggests that his father could have Asperger's syndrome, similar to Alan, Tim's son. However, John gets upset and leaves abruptly, getting into a physical altercation in which he accidentally breaks Tim's nose. Savannah witnesses the incident and stops communicating with John. Later on, John apologizes to Tim, who offers to pass along a message to Savannah. Middle Street is home to several boutique shops and art galleries, where visitors find unique treasures like handmade jewelry, locally-made artwork, and one-of-a-kind souvenirs. Middle Street also offers access to Sullivan's Island's stunning beaches, with public beach access points located just steps from the main drag. Visitors can spend the day lounging in the sun, swimming in the warm waters of the Atlantic, or taking a peaceful stroll along the shoreline. Overall, this charming street offers a taste of island life, with great food, friendly locals, and plenty of opportunities to relax and enjoy the natural beauty of the South Carolina coast. To reach 1111 Middle St, Sullivan's Island, navigate your way from I-26 E.

After summer ends, Savannah goes back to school, but she later meets with John for one final day together. Before leaving, they promise to keep their relationship alive by communicating through letters and vow to be honest with each other. They also make plans to start a life together after he leaves the Army. However, while at school, dozens of cell phones ring ominously, bringing the tragic news of 9/11. John and his team decide to extend their deployments, prolonging their separation from one another for months that eventually turn into years. Randolph Hall is a historic building situated in the heart of the College of Charleston campus. The building was constructed in 1828 and was originally used as a hotel. However, in 1854, the hotel was converted into an academic building. Today, Randolph Hall serves as the primary administrative building of the College of Charleston. It houses the offices of the college's president and provost, among others. The building's beautiful architecture, including its white columns and red brick facade, makes it an important landmark on campus. To get to Randolph Hall, College of Charleston, situated at 66 George St, Charleston, begin your journey by heading southeast on Meeting St from downtown Charleston towards George St. Alternatively, head north on King St towards Calhoun St.

In 2003 John is shot in Afghanistan. He wakes up in the hospital with several wounds. After 3 months of recovering, he goes to Captain Stone (Keith D. Robinson) to tell him that he is going to continue his service. But the Captain encourages John to get back home to stay with his father and have a rest. Established in 1842, The Citadel is a highly reputable military college situated in Charleston, South Carolina. It has earned a reputation for its rigorous academic program that emphasizes discipline and excellence. The institution is recognized for producing some of the most notable military leaders in the country. The campus is replete with historic Gothic-style architecture, adding an extra layer of grandeur to the institution. A popular attraction on campus is the barracks, where students reside and receive training, providing visitors with a unique glimpse into the daily life of cadets as they pursue their studies. If you are traveling by public transportation, use the CARTA bus system in Charleston. The nearest bus stop to 171 Moultrie Street is located at the intersection of Ashley Avenue and Moultrie Street. From there, you can walk to The Citadel in about 5-10 minutes.

The romantic drama Dear John used South Carolina as its backdrop for its story of love and loss. Filmed on the picturesque Oak Island, Edisto Island, Sullivan's Island, and other locations throughout the state, any huge fan of the Rom-com or a wanderlust would enjoy traversing the filming locations of Dear John. The beaches provided an intimate setting for all the tender moments between John and Savannah, while also featuring stunning ocean blues that provide the perfect backdrop to snap Insragramable photos of your trip. The landscapes of South Carolina also added a nostalgic feel to the story, as it acted as a reminder of how much time had passed since their love first began. From beach bonfires to romantic bike rides along palm tree-lined roads, there are plenty of diverse landscapes to explore in the area. Overall, Dear John was able to capture all of the ups and downs that come with being in love through its use of picturesque locations in South Carolina. With a perfect mix of tragedy and triumph, viewers could appreciate both the beauty found in nature as well as the strength found within John and Savannah's relationship despite all odds.
